Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2009 09:02PM mailman wrote: Hi I rarely visit this discussion board anymore as I often find myself asking why this, why that, how come?  All of us in life usually come to a place where we ask ourselves "why am I here?"  The answer to  that question often changes as we mature and as we age.  Only after decades of life do  we tend dto have a clearer picture of the why's and on the how come's we have asked ourselves in our earlier years.  One of the reasons I kept coming  back to this board was to see how AlaskaDeb was doing.  I am saddened to hear about  her recent passing and can only say that I am a better person for just having had the opportunity to  read her posts.  She will be missed by many who never even met her.  Many ,  myself  included , found comfort in her positive attitude and in her inner strength that her cancer could not take away from her.  That my friends is how to live.
